verse-info.verse: Woe to those who give less [than due],
description: In the original the word mutaffifin has
been used, which is derived from tatfif,
a word used for an inferior and
base thing in Arabic. Terminologically, tatfif is
used for giving short weight and short
measure fraudulently, for the person who acts
thus while measuring or weighing, does not
defraud another by any substantial amount, but
skimps small amounts from what is due
to every customer cleverly, and the poor
customer dces not know of what and
of how much he is being deprived
by the seller.

verse-info.verse: Who, when they take a measure from people, take in full.
But if they give by measure or by weight to them, they cause loss.
description: At several places in the Qur'an giving
of short measure and weight has been
condemned and measuring fully and weighing rightly
has been stressed. In Surah AI-An'am, it
has been enjoined: "You should use a
full measure and a just balance. We
charge one only with that much responsibility
that one can bear." (v. 152). In
Surah Bani Isra'il it has been said:
"Give full measure when you measure and
weigh with even scales." (v. 35). In
Surah Ar-Rehman it has been stressed: Do
not upset the balance: weigh with equity
and do not give short weight." (vv.
8-9). The people of the Prophet Shu`aib
were punished for the reason that the
evil of giving short measure and weight
had become widespread among them and in
spite of his counsel and advice they
did not refrain from it.

verse-info.verse: Do they not think that they will be resurrected
For a tremendous Day -
description: "A Great Day": the Day of Resurrection
when all men and jinn will be
called to account together in the Divine
Court and decisions of vital importance will
be made pertaining to rewards and punishments.

verse-info.verse: The Day when mankind will stand before the Lord of the worlds?
No! Indeed, the record of the wicked is in sijjeen.
description: That is, "These people are wrong in
thinking that they will be let off
without being called to account when they
have committed such and such crimes in
the world. "
*5) The word sijjin
in the original is derived from sijn
(a prison) and the explanation of it
that follows shows that it implies the
general Register in which the actions and
deeds of the people worthy of punishment
are being recorded.

verse-info.verse: And what can make you know what is sijjeen?
It is [their destination recorded in] a register inscribed.
Woe, that Day, to the deniers,
Who deny the Day of Recompense.
And none deny it except every sinful transgressor.
When Our verses are recited to him, he says, "Legends of the former peoples."
description: "Our Revelations": those verses in which news
of the Day of Recompense has been
given.

verse-info.verse: No! Rather, the stain has covered their hearts of that which they were earning.
description: That is, they have no good reason
for regarding the meting out of rewards
and punishments as unreal. What has made
them say this, is that their hearts
have become rusty because of their sins;
therefore, a thing which is thoroughly reasonable
appears unreal and unreasonable to them. The
explanation of this rust as given by
the Holy Prophet (upon whom be peace)
is as follows: "When a servant commits
a sin, it marks a black stain
on his heart. If he offers repentance,
the stain is washed off, but if
he persists in wrongdoing. it spreads over
the whole heart." (Musnad Ahmad, Tirmidhi, Nasa'i,
Ibn Majah, Ibn Jarir, Hakim, Ibn Abi
Hatim, Ibn Hibban and others).

verse-info.verse: No! Indeed, from their Lord, that Day, they will be partitioned.
description: That is, these people will remain deprived
of the vision of Allah with which
the righteous will be blessed. (For further
explanation, see E.N. 17 of Al -
Qiyamah).

verse-info.verse: Then indeed, they will [enter and] burn in Hellfire.
Then it will be said [to them], "This is what you used to deny."
No! Indeed, the record of the righteous is in 'illiyyun.
description: That is, they are wrong in thinking
that there is going to be no
meting out of rewards and punishments.

verse-info.verse: And what can make you know what is 'illiyyun?
It is [their destination recorded in] a register inscribed
Which is witnessed by those brought near [to Allah].
Indeed, the righteous will be in pleasure
On adorned couches, observing.
You will recognize in their faces the radiance of pleasure.
They will be given to drink [pure] wine [which was] sealed.
description: One meaning of the words khltamu-hu misk
is that the vessels containing the wine
will carry the seal of musk instead
of clay or wax. Accordingly the verse
means: This will be the choicest kind
of wine, which will be superior to
the wine flowing in the canals, and
it will be served by the attendants
of Paradise in vessels sealed with musk
to the dwellers of Paradise. Another meaning
also can be: When that wine will
pass down the throat, its final effect
will be of the flavour of musk.
This state is contrary to the wines
of the world which give out an
offensive smell as soon as the bottle
opens and one feels its horrid smell
even while drinking and also when it
passes down the throat.

verse-info.verse: The last of it is musk. So for this let the competitors compete.
And its mixture is of Tasneem,
description: "Tasnim ".: height. Thus, Tasnim will be
a fountain flowing down from a height.

verse-info.verse: A spring from which those near [to Allah] drink.
Indeed, those who committed crimes used to laugh at those who believed.
And when they passed by them, they would exchange derisive glances.
And when they returned to their people, they would return jesting.
description: That is, they returned home rejoicing, thinking
that they had made fun of such
and such a Muslim, had passed evil
remarks against him and subjected him to
ridicule among the people.

verse-info.verse: And when they saw them, they would say, "Indeed, those are truly lost."
description: That is, they have lost their reason:
they have deprived themselves of the gains
and enjoyments of the world and have
experienced dangers and undergone hardships only for
the reason that Muhammad (upon whom be
Allah's peace and blessings) has deluded them
with the Hereafter, Heaven and Hell. They
are giving up whatever is present and
here on the false hope that the
promise of some Paradise has been held
out to them after death, and they
are enduring the hardships in the present
life only for the reason that they
have been threatened with some Hell in
the next world.

verse-info.verse: But they had not been sent as guardians over them.
description: In this brief sentence the mockers and
jesters have been given an instructive warning
to the effect: "Even if what the
Muslims have believed in, is false, they
are not harming you at all They
regard something as we and are accordingly
adopting a certain moral attitude for themselves,
for their own good. AIIah has not
appointed you to be keepers over them
so that you may be free to
criticise and persecute those who are not
harming you in any way."

verse-info.verse: So Today those who believed are laughing at the disbelievers,
On adorned couches, observing.
Have the disbelievers [not] been rewarded [this Day] for what they used to do?
description: There is a subtle satire in this
sentence. In the world, the disbelievers used
to persecute the believers, thinking it was
an act of virtue. In the Hereafter,
the believers will be enjoying life in
Paradise, and watching the disbelievers being punished
in Hell, will say to themselves what
a reward they have earned for their
acts of virtue!
